intro: Dipterodendron costaricense, commonly known as the Costa Rican dipterodendron, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has a woody stem with smooth, dark green leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
